title: Africa: Illicit Financial Flow - African Labour Unions to Pressure Big Businesses
text:
Nigeria: Troops Rout Boko Haram in Buratai's Hometown 
They said in a communique which was presented at the end of their meeting on Tuesday that the issue of financing Africa's structural transformation was key and needed urgent attention. 
"We wish to reiterate our commitment to support our governments and the African Union in their fight to defeat illicit financial flows from our continent," the unions said. 
They further added: "We shall continue to pressure big businesses and multinational companies to pay their fair and true share of tax in countries where their production and profit activities take place. 
The financial hemorrhage as a result of Illicit Financial Flows (IFF) continues to harm our economies and people as monies for social spending on education, potable water, health and sanitation, food and nutrition that are real drivers of development are lost because businesses continue to find ways to manipulate tax rules and administrations." 
"We therefore say stop the bleeding, which is our on-going campaign on halting Illicit Financial Flows from Africa," they said. Africa
